com.amazonaws.mobile.client

Class AWSMobileClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.mobile.client.AWSMobileClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AWSCredentialsProvider

    public final class AWSMobileClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements AWSCredentialsProvider
    AWSMobileClient is a high-level SDK client that initilalizes the SDK, fetches Cognito Identity and creates other SDK client instances. 
      To initialize the SDK, invoke the initialize(Context)
  method:

  AWSMobileClient.getInstance().initialize(this);

  To get a callback when the initalize is successful, invoke the
  initialize(Context, AWSStartupHandler) method.

  AWSMobileClient.getInstance().initalize(this, new AWSStartupHandler() {

      • getCredentials

        public AWSCredentials getCredentials()
        Description copied from interface: AWSCredentialsProvider
        Returns AWSCredentials which the caller can use to authorize an AWS request. Each implementation of AWSCredentialsProvider can chose its own strategy for loading credentials. For example, an implementation might load credentials from an existing key management system, or load new credentials when credentials are rotated.
        Specified by:
        getCredentials in interface AWSCredentialsProvider
        Returns:
        AWSCredentials which the caller can use to authorize an AWS request.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Description copied from interface: AWSCredentialsProvider
        Forces this credentials provider to refresh its credentials. For many implementations of credentials provider, this method may simply be a no-op, such as any credentials provider implementation that vends static/non-changing credentials. For other implementations that vend different credentials through out their lifetime, this method should force the credentials provider to refresh its credentials.
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface AWSCredentialsProvider

      • federatedSignIn

        public void federatedSignIn(java.lang.String providerKey,
                            java.lang.String token,
                            Callback<UserStateDetails> callback)
        Federate tokens from custom identity providers by providing the logins key and token

        The logins key can be specified with IdentityProvider#AMAZON#toString()

        Parameters:
        providerKey - Custom provider key i.e. Google sign-in's key is accounts.google.com
        token - the JWT token vended by the third-party

      • federatedSignIn

        public void federatedSignIn(java.lang.String providerKey,
                            java.lang.String token)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Federate tokens from custom identity providers by providing the logins key and token

        The logins key can be specified with IdentityProvider.AMAZON

        Parameters:
        providerKey - Custom provider key i.e. Google sign-in's key is accounts.google.com
        token - the JWT token vended by the third-party
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTokens

        public Tokens getTokens()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the tokens obtained from Cognito Userpools sign-in. Federated sign-in tokens are not supported.
        Returns:
        tokens from Cognito Userpools
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • signUp

        public void signUp(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> userAttributes,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> validationData,
                   Callback<SignUpResult> callback)
        Sign-up users. The SignUpResult will contain next steps if necessary. Call confirmSignUp with the necessary next step code obtained from user.
        Parameters:
        username - username/email address/handle
        password - user's password
        userAttributes - attributes associated with user
        validationData - optional, set of data to validate the sign-up request
        callback - callback

      • initialize

        @Deprecated
public AWSMobileClient.InitializeBuilder initialize(android.content.Context context)
        Deprecated. Since 2.8.0 This method will be removed in the next minor version. Please update to use AWSMobileClient using `initialize`. Please visit https://aws-amplify.github.io for the latest Android documentation.
        This performs basic initialization for connecting to AWS including fetching the Cognito Identity for the user.
        Parameters:
        context - The activity context.

      • initialize

public AWSMobileClient.InitializeBuilder initialize(android.content.Context context,
                                                                AWSStartupHandler awsStartupHandler)
        Deprecated. Since 2.8.0 This method will be removed in the next minor version. Please update to use AWSMobileClient using `initialize`. Please visit https://aws-amplify.github.io for the latest Android documentation.
        This performs basic initialization for connecting to AWS including fetching the Cognito Identity for the user.
        Parameters:
        context - The activity context.
        awsStartupHandler - The result for Initialize callback.
